reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Scaling-up of high impact and integrated community interventions in the fight against HIV and TB

description.narrative: Burkina Faso - TB/HIV - Initiative Privée et Communautaire pour la Santé et la Riposte au VIH/SIDA au Burkina Faso (IPC/BF) - IPC/BF. This program has the following goals: Les nouvelles infections sont réduites de 75% à l'horizon 2025. New infections are reduced by 75% by 2025.. La mortalité liée au VIH est réduite de 70% chez les PVVIH à l'horizon 2025. HIV-related mortality is reduced by 70% among PLWHIV by 2025.. Les obstacles et inégalités liés aux droits humains et au genre qui entravent l’accès aux services sont réduites à l'horizon 2025. Human rights and gender-related barriers and inequalities that impede access to services are reduced by 2025.. La gouvernance est renforcée au niveau central et régional. Governance is strengthened at central and regional levels. Contribuer à l’amélioration de l’état de santé de la population du Burkina Faso en réduisant le poids de la tuberculose d’ici à fin 2025. To contribute to the improvement of the health status of the population of Burkina Faso by reducing the burden of tuberculosis by the end of 2025.. Réduire l’incidence de la tuberculose de 48 en 2018 à 40 cas/100 000 habitants en 2025 et le taux de mortalité de 7,8 à 5,7 décès/100 000 habitants d’ici à fin 2025. Reduce the incidence of tuberculosis from 48 in 2018 to 40 cases/100,000 inhabitants in 2025 and the mortality rate from 7.8 to 5.7 deaths/100,000 inhabitants by the end of 2025.. The objectives of this program are: 95% des populations clés (TS, HSH, Usagers de drogue, Détenus, PVVIH), vulnérables (adolescents et jeunes, Personnes handicapées, femmes en âge de procréer, PDI et refugiés) et passerelles (Orpailleurs et routiers) utilisent le paquet de services de prévention combinée selon des approches différenciées à l’horizon 2025. 95% of key populations (sex workers, MSM, drug users, prisoners, PLWHIV), vulnerable populations (adolescents and young people, people with disabilities, women of childbearing age, IDPs and refugees) and bridge populations (gold diggers and truck drivers) will use the combined prevention services package according to differentiated approaches by 2025.. 100% des structures impliquées dans la PEC des IST, la Sécurité transfusionnelle et la Prophylaxie post exposition au VIH adoptent des mesures pour l’élimination des cas de nouvelles infections à VIH d’ici 2025. 100% of facilities involved in STI CEP, Transfusion Safety and HIV Post Exposure Prophylaxis adopt measures to eliminate cases of new HIV infections by 2025.. L’élimination de la transmission du VIH et des IST de la mère à l’enfant est certifiée au Burkina Faso à l’horizon 2025. The elimination of mother-to-child transmission of HIV and STIs is certified in Burkina Faso by 2025.. 95% des PVVIH sont intégrées dans le dispositif de prise en charge médicale en vigueur à l'horizon 2025. 95% of PLWHIV are integrated into the medical care system in force by 2025.. 95% des PVVIH sous traitement ARV ont une charge virale indétectable et 95% des PVVIH sont retenues sous traitement ARV à l'horizon 2025. 95% of PLWHIV on ARV treatment have an undetectable viral load and 95% of PLWHIV are retained on ARV treatment by 2025.. L’information stratégique de qualité sur la réponse nationale au VIH est disponible. Quality strategic information on the national response to HIV is available.. Réduire le taux de décès chez les patients TB/VIH de 20% (cohorte 2018) à moins de 5% (cohorte 2024) . Reduce the death rate among TB/HIV patients from 20% (cohort 2018) to less than 5% (cohort 2024). Diagnostiquer et mettre sous traitement 40 641 malades TB de 2021 à 2025 avec une augmentation du taux de couverture du traitement de la TB (notifiés/incidence estimée) de 63% en 2018 à 90% en 2025. To diagnose and treat 40,641 TB patients from 2021 to 2025 with an increase in TB treatment coverage (reported/estimated incidence) from 63% in 2018 to 90% in 2025.. Augmenter la proportion des nouveaux patients et rechutes de TB toutes formes ayant bénéficié du test Xpert MTB/RIF en diagnostic initial de 21 % en 2018 à 98% en 2025. To increase the proportion of new patients and relapses of all forms of TB having benefited from the Xpert MTB/RIF test in initial diagnosis from 21% in 2018 to 98% in 2025.. Accroître le taux de succès au traitement des patients TB pharmaco sensibles de 79,1% (cohorte 2018) à au moins 90% (cohorte 2024) et ceux TB-résistante de 61,8% (cohorte 2018) à au moins 85% (cohorte 2024). Assurer le traitement antituberculeux à 100% des patients TB des zones à déficit sécuritaire. Ensuring 100% TB treatment for TB patients in unsafe areas

title.narrative: Coverage / Output indicator for BFA-C-IPC
Percentage of men who have sex with men reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Proportion of facility reports received over the reports expected during the reporting period
Number of notified TB cases (all forms) contributed by non-national TB program providers – community referrals
Percentage of other vulnerable populations reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Percentage of sex workers that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
TB/HIV Other 1: Number of PLHIV suspected of TB refered by community associations to the CDT
DOTS-other 1: Number of TB suspects referred from the community level to health facilities
Number of women and men aged 15+ who received an HIV test and know their results
Percentage of men who have sex with men that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Percentage of other vulnerable populations that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Number of people who were tested for HIV and received their results during the reporting period
Percentage of sex workers reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
DOTS-other 2: Number of smear positive pulmonary TB cases detected based on referrals from the community health workers and associations involved in the programme
Proportion of undernourished PLHIV that received therapeutic or supplementary food at any point during the reporting period
TCS - Other 1: Proportion of PLHIV having benefited from community care
TCP Other 1: Percentage of PLHIV that have benefited from treament and case management at the community level.
Number of people in prisons or other closed settings that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
TCS-other 1: Number and proportion of PHIV having received a community service
Percentage of community based monitoring reports presented to relevant oversight mechanisms
Number of people in prisons and other closed settings reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
M&E-other 1: Proportion of Community Based Organisations (CBOs) who submitting their reports to the sub-recipients (SRs) in a timely and complete manner as per guidelines
Impact indicator for BFA-C-IPC
TB/HIV mortality rate per 100,000 population
Percentage of sex workers who are living with HIV
Number of AIDS-related deaths per 100,000 population
TB mortality rate per 100,000 population
Percentage of other vulnerable populations (specify) who are living with HIV
Percentage of young people aged 15–24 who are living with HIV
RR-TB and/or MDR-TB prevalence among new TB patients: Proportion of new TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB
Percentage of people living with HIV
Percentage of men who have sex with men who are living with HIV
Estimated percentage of children newly infected with HIV from mother-to-child transmission among women living with HIV delivering in the past 12 months
TB incidence rate per 100,000 population
TB prevalence rate per 100,000 population
Outcome indicator for BFA-C-IPC
Case notification rate of all forms of TB per 100,000 population - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, new and relapse cases

TB treatment coverage: Percentage of new and relapse cases that were notified and treated among the estimated number of incident TB cases in the same year (all form of TB - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed)
Percentage of people living with HIV who know their HIV status at the end of the reporting period
Percentage of men reporting the use of a condom the last time they had anal sex with a non regular partner
Treatment success rate of RR TB and/or MDR-TB: Percentage of cases with RR and/or MDR-TB successfully treated
Notification of RR-TB and/or MDR-TB cases – Percentage of notified cases of bacteriologically confirmed, drug resistant RR-TB and/or MDR-TB as a proportion of all estimated RR-TB and/or MDR-TB cases

Notification of RR-TB and/or MDR-TB cases - Percentage of notified cases of bacteriologically confirmed, drug resistant RR-TB and/or MDR-TB⃰ as a proportion of the estimated number of RR-TB and/or MDR-TB cases among notified TB cases
Percentage of adults and children with HIV, known to be on treatment 12 months after initiation of antiretroviral therapy
Percentage of people living with HIV and on ART who are virologically suppressed
Percentage of (estimated) people living with HIV who have been tested HIV-positive
Treatment success rate of all forms of TB - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, new and relapse cases
Treatment success rate - bacteriologically confirmed TB cases
Percentage of men reporting the use of a condom the last time they had anal sex with a male partner
Percentage of sex workers reporting the use of a condom with their most recent client
